Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to acquire|to obtain|to purchase|to buy|to reclaim
Node.definition: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

= strip ◄ of linen or leather; ► worn around the waist to hold one's robe in place; sometimes used to keep money and other things; ≈ since it is worn so close to one's body it is sometimes associated with a person's basic principles

= woven material made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of cloth and clothes, but can also be used as a measuring line; worn by priests; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place

= the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

= state of having reached the terminal point of an event
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation
= state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect

= strip ◄ of linen or leather; ► worn around the waist to hold one's robe in place; sometimes used to keep money and other things; ≈ since it is worn so close to one's body it is sometimes associated with a person's basic principles
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to be useful|to be good (for something)
Node.definition: = state in which an object can be used for an intended or desired outcome
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= state in which an object is positioned around or against another object in such a way that the two cannot be separated easily

= strip ◄ of linen or leather; ► worn around the waist to hold one's robe in place; sometimes used to keep money and other things; ≈ since it is worn so close to one's body it is sometimes associated with a person's basic principles

= the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

Node.gloss: to cause to cling|to cause to commit oneself
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to commit oneself to remain closely involved with another person or group, out of affection and/or solidarity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= earthenware vessel, ► used as a storage container for liquids like wine and olive oil
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= earthenware vessel, ► used as a storage container for liquids like wine and olive oil
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to fill (with an activity); hence: = causative action in which deities cause humans to be fully engaged in a certain activity, either as victim or as active participant

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
literally: to sit on a throne; hence: = action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ symbolized by taking position on the seat that represents this position of authority
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
the throne representing someone's position as monarch or judge

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state of being intoxicated ◄ as a result of having drunk too much wine; ≈ associated with large quantities

Node.gloss: a man ... his brother > one ... each other
Node.definition: = expression denoting a situation in which two people or objects that are regarded as masculine are involved in a reciprocal event
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to do something that may have a negative effect on someone or something else; ◄ usually caused by an emotion of affection or compassion

Node.gloss: to be merciful|to have mercy (on someone)|to have compassion (on someone)
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities feel compassion for other, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action: a person who feels compassion may forgive an offence, refrain from aggression and/or punishment, or revoke punishment
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

Node.gloss: to be exalted|to be proud|to be haughty|to be arrogant
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

Node.gloss: to bring darkness|to make dark|to darken
Node.definition: = causative process by which deities cause the light to gradually disappear, ◄ by making sure that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

Node.gloss: to hurt one's foot (on something) > to hurt oneself|to stumble
Node.definition: = process by which a human's foot or both feet come in forcible contact with a stone or other object while travelling, ► which may result in stumbling and injury; ≈ usually used in a figurative way to denote sustaining any kind of hardship in life
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= a place where humans or animals go in order to not be readily seen by others, ► either to keep safe from danger or to attack others

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans
= process by which the eye produces tears (דִּמְעָה) ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= process by which the eye produces tears (דִּמְעָה) ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= process by which tears flow in copious amounts from the eyes of humans ◄ as a result of deep sorrow

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= causative action by which people, animals or objects are forcibly carried off; ► in the case of people, into slavery or exile
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a respectful way of referring to the mother of the king
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to fall down|to sink down|to descend
Node.definition: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

read מֵרֹאשְׁכֶם = רֹאשׁ (רֹאשׁ)|= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= an area of land located in the south of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples initially by the Canaanites in Arad (עֲרָד) and the Amelekites (עֲמָלֵקִי) later, the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= causative action by which humans close the entrance(s) to a location, supposedly by shutting its doors (דֶּלֶת)

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= causative action by which a group of people is forced to leave their country to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which humans or deities give someone else a certain responsibility or position of authority with regards to an object, a group of people, or an entire land or nation
= a referent to a female participant addressed in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= person, male or female, with whom one has a special bond, such as friendship, marriage, a covenant, etc., ≈ usually regarded with affection and seen as trustworthy
literally: head; hence: = the person in leadership of a group of people, or, by extension, the most important object among a set of objects
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= experience of having painful contractions of the womb; ◄ caused by advanced state of pregnancy; ► and resulting in the birth of new offspring; ≈ associated with fear and agony

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= process by which a female gives birth to offspring; ≈ associated with pain and anguish

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to meet; hence: = process by which a certain event starts affecting someone
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= causative action by which someone causes someone else to take off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which brings shame on that person and to those who stand in a close relation to them
= the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist
= action by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans with which they have a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich themselves in one way or another
literally: heels; hence: = euphemistic expression denoting the reproductive organs
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= causative process by which humans, deities, or forces give (other) humans or objects a different nature, character, or form
= member of the ethnic group ◄ that is regarded as descendants of Cush, son of Ham (חָם)
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

= one of the great cat family of about 2 m in length and of a yellowish brown color with black spots arranged in rosettes all over the body and the tail; ◄ Panthera pardus; ► hunts by stalking prey; ≈ symbol of violent danger
= spot on the skin; ≈ symbol of a condition that cannot be altered

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= state in which humans have acquired knowledge or a skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= action by which humans or deities act in a way that is morally and/or ethically right

= dry grass like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= a pattern of events that someone will be involved in, described as an allotment from God, often as a consequence of one's life choices
= a certain quantity of something that is alotted to an individual or group
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= state in which objects or activities do not serve a valid purpose and can only lead to disappointment
= marker pointing out that the information that follows represents the logical consequence of what has been stated before
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which humans, deities, or animals remove an object that thinly covers another object
= the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
= action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their husband or wife; ≈ often used as a metaphor for idolatry
= action by which a horse utters a prolonged cry; ≈ sometimes associated with a man's desire for another man's wife
literally: plan; hence: = a state of moral and ethical corruption, starting with evil plans and resulting in depraved practices, ≈ regarded as foolishness
= action by which humans engage in non sanctioned worship, ◄ described in terms of prostitution
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a reference to the physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship, ≈ with a very strong added connotation of something utterly detestable
exclamation expressing grief and dismay
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= process by which an area or object becomes free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
